title: Red Velvet Oreo Cookie Review - Oreo Oration
description:
There's a new Oreo just in time for Valentine's Day -- but it is any good?

Get everything early here: http://www.patreon.com/kindafunny

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=gameovergreggy

Buy our shirts! http://www.districtlines.com/gameovergreggy

Each and every Friday, Greg Miller, Colin Moriarty, Nick Scarpino, and Tim Gettys get together to talk. Each podcaster brings a topic to the table, and then, they go. TV, space, books, movies -- anything goes.

Follow us on Twitter!
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/NoTaxation
Nick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_Scarpino
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys

transcript_chunks.text: what's up everybody Welcome to Oreo Oration I'm Greg Miller and while you were out living your life, the folks at Oreo were making endless variations of milk's favorite cookie. So every time there's a crazy flavor, I tear open a new package and give you a tasty review without any calories. If you like that, like the video, subscribe to our channel, share us with your friends - can't stress how important that last part is. Today we're reviewing Red Velvet Oreo cookies. Now let me want to talk about a journey the Oreo people have taken us on, ladies and gentlemen. Months ago, a screenshot of this leaked, people start tweeting me: "Is it real? Is it real?" And I say definitively no, it is not real. Anytime here's what's wrong with the rumors about the Oreo cookies anytime they get started - whether it be the Fried Chicken Oreo, whether it be the Ramen Oreo - if there's only one screenshot of the package, it's fake. Now I think this probably leaked 'cause it's the exact same milk look here it's the

It be the Fried Chicken Oreo, whether it be the Ramen Oreo. If there's only one screenshot of the package, it's fake. Now I think this probably leaked because it's the exact same mil look here - it's the exact same cream cheese flavored cream like this is literally the packaging they leaked with the little thing there on the counter and that and whatever. So I get the fact that that was just probably a leak from someone inside Nabisco, not Abisco, left his iPad on a cookie bender everything went off the rails now they're real maybe Oreo is just testing the waters which is a brilliant thing to do - leak these images then see what happens, see if people want them. I'm standing by the fact that I would love Fried Chicken Oreos, sounds gross when you think about it but chicken and waffles are sweet and savory try it. Ramen Oreos is gross don't ever make those so Red Velvet Oreo cookies they're out February 2nd stores nationwide I got the early taste we're going to get into the review
